It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant thrives in wetland environments, often in shallow, still waters with nutrient-rich substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
